page.title: 08Halewood Shopping Survey
page.content: Forty families were questioned about their shopping habits. Most people go shopping daily in our area, but a quarter only go shopping once a week There were no set times that people went to the shops. Everybody we questioned used the local shops at some time or other, mainly for basic foodstuffs. All the people concerned also travelled out of Halewood to do shopping. There were a number of complaints about the local shops. The price of goods was a main complaint because of a lack of competition. Discourteous staff and dirty premises also caused complaints. Only six people had no complaints at all. Certain types of shops were thought to be needed. These were supermarkets, a shoe shop, a D.I.Y. shop, decent clothes shops and a market.
